intro: Cadetia leucantha, commonly known as white sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cariophyllaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its delicate, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Cadetia leucantha thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
